0.Pros: Honestly, McDonald's is one of the richest fast food restaurants in the U.S. This job taught me a lot, like patience, great customer service skills effort and consistency.
0.Cons: They seem to be disorganized. Don't have direct deposit and always complaining about how they don't have enough money to do anything.

1.Pros: Always willing to work with you on your hours/ very flexable. Comfortable work environment and resonable work for job description.
1.Cons: Only pays $10 for a job that should be paid a minimum of $20. Does not have updated advertising so I had to create and devlope an advertising plan. I work as a secretary, office manager, and advertising representative and am paid $10 an hour before taxes.

2.Pros: Good starting job and I felt appreciated by my managers. The schedule can move around a bit when people don't show up.
2.Cons: Not much of a career opportunity. Management seems to be overworked.

5.Pros: You get to be a fry cook

6.Pros: Not really any pros unless you like eating Mcdonalds all day
6.Cons: No shift flexibility, low pay, leave smelling disgusting and greasy.

7.Pros: You get to meet new people
7.Cons: The owners dont give out raises

8.Pros: Flexible Schedule, decent pay, fun working environment. Good Experience

9.Pros: I learn how to move fast and you get used to standing on your feet all day. You can and will promote and get a raise quickly.
